sentences.en: After this the young woman became thinner and paler.
sentences.cn: 妇人是一天天地黄瘦了.

sentences.en: As she looked up to see who I meant — though already knowing, probably, from my tone — suddenly he looked at her, the thinner one, the boyish one, the youngest, perhaps.
sentences.cn: 当她抬头看向我所指的人时——也许从我的声音里就已经听出来了——忽然，他看着她，那个最瘦的，最孩子气的，也许是最年轻的男孩。

sentences.en: He is getting thinner every day.
He was a little thinner, a little whiter, a little more austere.
sentences.cn: 他稍微瘦了些 、 脸色白了些, 也更严肃了些.

sentences.en: He's much thinner nowadays than he used to be; I think he's been ill.
sentences.cn: 最近他比以前瘦多了, 我想他一直在生病.

sentences.en: It's clear that he is getting thinner every day.
She has one slightly withered leg, noticeably thinner than the other.
sentences.cn: 她有一条腿有点儿萎缩，看上去明显比另一条腿瘦。

sentences.en: She is noticeably thinner after her illness.
The back muscles of the thoracic region are thinner.
The clay is very stiff; we must make it thinner with water.
sentences.cn: 这粘土非常稠, 我们须用水使它变得稀一些.

sentences.en: The higher we go above the earth, the thinner the air is.
sentences.cn: 我们离开地面越高, 空气越稀薄.

sentences.en: Two of the lorries, carrying industrial resin and paint thinner, burst into flames.
sentences.cn: 其中运载工业树脂和涂料稀释剂的两辆卡车起火了。

sentences.en: Will you keep on the course of exercises until you are thinner?
sentences.cn: 你要继续这项训练直到身体瘦下来为止 吗 ?

words.tran_cn: 薄的；瘦的；稀薄的；微弱的

trans.tran_cn: 薄的；细的；瘦的；稀少的；稀疏的（thin的比较级）
（油漆的）稀释剂，使变稀薄者，加稀料的制漆工
